title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in most parts of the island during the afternoon or night.

title: Notice on bus and train services for today and tomorrow
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that passenger transport buses will be in operation starting today (15), based on public need.

title: El Salvador’s Bukele says he will not return man the US mistakenly deported
byline: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele said at the White House on Monday he had no plans to return a man mistakenly deported from the United States, suggesting that doing so would be like smuggling a terrorist into the country.

title: Police hunt for man who held 12-year-old girl captive in Keselwatta
byline: Police have launched an investigation into an incident where a girl sustained injuries after reportedly jumping from the second floor of a house on Peer Saibo Road in Keselwatta.

title: Six-year-old dead, several injured in Elpitiya accident
byline: A six-year-old girl has died in an accident reported along the Elpitiya-Ambalangoda road in Kurundugaha, Elpitiya this morning (Apr 15).

title: Tamil Nadu CM seeks more state powers from Central government
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin is likely to move the State Autonomy resolution in the legislative Assembly today.

title: Police on the lookout for man who held 12-year-old in captive in Keselwatta
byline: Police have launched an investigation into an incident where a child sustained injuries after reportedly jumping from the second floor of a house on Peer Saibo Road in Keselwatta.

title: Public Security Minister confirms Gammanpila met Pillayan, no permission for ex-President Ranil
byline: A request made by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe to have a discussion with former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, alias Pillayan, who is currently in the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) under a detention order, has been denied.

title: Record fall in Japanese nationals as population declines
byline: The number of Japanese nationals living in the country saw a record year-on-year fall of 898,000 people to 120.3 million as of October 2024, official data showed on Monday (Apr 14).

title: Two killed after vehicle veers off the road in Mihintale
byline: Two persons have died in an accident reported in Wellamorana, Mihintale this morning (15), Police said.

title: HBO reveals first cast members for Harry Potter TV series
byline: Nick Frost, Paapa Essiedu, Janet McTeer and Paul Whitehouse will appear in the forthcoming Harry Potter TV series, US network HBO has confirmed.

title: 412 admitted to National Hospital due to accidents during New Year
byline: A total of 412 persons have been admitted to the Colombo National Hospital owing to injuries sustained from various accidents reported on 13 and 14 April.

title: LG polls campaigning peaceful, no major incidents: PAFFREL
byline: Campaigning activities for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has been largely peaceful so far, according to a local election watchdog.

title: EC makes special requests from parties and independent groups
byline: A special request has been made by the National Election Commission from political parties and independent groups that have initiated legal proceedings against any rejection of nomination papers related to the 2025 Local Government (LG) election.

title: Singapore dissolves parliament, paving the way for May 3 general election
byline: Singapore’s parliament was dissolved Tuesday, paving the way for general elections in which the city-state’s long-ruling People’s Action Party will seek to strengthen its dominance under Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

title: Only 30-35% private buses in operation; SLTB ready to increase journeys
byline: Only 30 to 35% of the private buses are in operation today due to the low demand, says the Chairman of the Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) Gemunu Wijeratne.

title: Shooter in former Boossa Prison superintendent’s murder arrested at BIA
byline: The suspect allegedly responsible for the recent shooting of the retired Superintendent of the Boossa Prison was arrested this morning (15) by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) while attempting to leave the country through the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake.

title: Nearly 500,000 vehicles use expressways during New Year period
byline: The revenue generated from expressway tolls during the past four days has exceeded Rs. 170 million, the Road Development Authority (RDA) said.

title: Two dead, 2 injured in crash caused by drunk driver
byline: A three-wheeler driver and a passenger have died in an accident along the Kurunegala-Dambulla A6 road in Doratiyawa, Kurunegala this morning.

title: Extreme heat: Health experts share dos and don’ts
byline: Special attention must be paid to the prevailing extreme heat in the country, health experts warn.

title: Pakistan deports nearly 60,000 Afghan refugees in 13 days: IOM
byline: Pakistan has deported nearly 60,000 Afghan refugees through two border points during the past 13 days, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: China accuses US of launching ‘advanced’ cyberattacks, names alleged NSA agents
byline: China accused the United States National Security Agency (NSA) on Tuesday of launching “advanced” cyberattacks during the Asian Winter Games in February, targeting essential industries.

title: CEB issues another notice to rooftop solar system owners
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reiterated that owners of rooftop solar systems must switch off their units until 03.00 p.m. on a daily basis until 21 April if they receive an SMS from the board.

title: US national arrested at BIA with ‘Kush’ cannabis worth Rs. 230M
byline: An American national has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning (15), by officers of the Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs for attempting to smuggle 23 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis into the country.

title: New access routes introduced for Sacred Tooth Relic exposition
byline: The Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy has announced the introduction of three dedicated access routes in preparation for the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, which is scheduled to commence on April 18.

title: Two arrested with over Rs. 5.7M on money laundering charges
byline: Two suspects have been arrested on charges of money laundering and aiding and abetting money laundering, along with Rs. 5,745,000 in cash found in their possession.

title: China says it is ‘tearing down walls’ to expand trade alliances amid US standoff
byline: China is “tearing down walls” and expanding its circle of trading partners, “shaking hands” instead of “shaking fists”, its foreign ministry said on Tuesday, as Beijing works on diversifying ties amid an escalating trade war with the U.S.
